definition: shill/tout/phony customer who pretends to buys things so as to lure real customers
childcare
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
nursery

sentences.english: Children living in remote places cannot get to the playgroup .
sentences.chinese: 住在远处的孩子们不能进游戏托儿所。

sentences.english: This is like a creche system.
sentences.chinese: 这就像托儿所系统一样。

sentences.english: Put a creche in your home .
The women picked up their babies in the nursery on their any home from the factory.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们从工厂回家，顺路到托儿所把要婴孩带回。

sentences.english: We have a crèche and childcare services.
sentences.chinese: 我们有托儿所及照料儿童的服务。

sentences.english: Too few women are in full-time work, partly because child-care support is lacking.
sentences.chinese: 很少有女人担任全职工作，部分因为缺乏托儿服务。

sentences.english: They take their children to nurseries or day-care centres.
sentences.chinese: 他们带他们的小孩到托儿所或安亲班。
塔什干，乌克兰，日间托儿所。

sentences.english: Angawadi workers are studying health and children education knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 乡村托儿所的教师埋首学习卫生及儿童教育知识。

sentences.english: Later, when I was about 7, I used to collect my younger sister from the nursery.
sentences.chinese: 后来，到我大约七岁的时候，我常去托儿所接我妹妹。

sentences.english: If a product is bad, the company cannot recruit buzzers.
sentences.chinese: 如果一个产品不好，那么公司就雇不到托儿。

sentences.english: They ran the nurseries extremely well.
sentences.chinese: 他们把托儿所办得很好。

sentences.english: It typically occurs in small epidemics in nursery schools or kindergartens, usually during the summer and autumn months.
sentences.chinese: 常在夏季和秋季多发于托儿所，幼稚园等场所。

sentences.english: The babies were bawling in the nursery.
sentences.chinese: 托儿所的婴儿都在啼哭。

sentences.english: Every community is served by one or more nurseries, schools and clinics.
sentences.chinese: 每一个街道有一个或更多的托儿所，学校和医疗站。

definition: person hired to lure customers to high-priced restaurants
person hired to lure customers to high-priced bars
to tout/to solicit customers
swindler/a cheat
to procure/to act as pimp
to cheat sb
lit. to sing a duet/fig. to collaborate with sb/also used satirically: to play second fiddle to
to cheat/to swindle
pimp
to collect money/to raise funds (for charity)
a form of theatrical double act in which one performer speaks or sings while the other, in front, pretends to be doing the speaking or singing/double reed (as in an oboe or bassoon)
to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
hospital scalper/sb who for a profit entices others to obtain medical care
to cheat/to deceive
ticket scalper
to solicit (guests, clients, passengers etc)/to importune
